result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephanie A King

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Stephanie A King appeared by video for Mendota Mental Health Institution.  
Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons in court for Stephanie A King.  
ADA Chad Wozniak and  Michael Christopher Schindhelm in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Testimony of Dr. Cohen Continues.
Statements made by the parties. 
Court Denied the State's Motion for Involuntary Medication Order reasons placed on the record.
State request this matter to reset on Judge Borowski Calendar. Request Denied. 
Review Hearing will be held before Judge Franke  on November 17 at 9:00am

Defendant Stephanie A King appeared by video for Mendota Mental Health Institution.  Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons in court for Stephanie A King.  ADA Chad Wozniak on behalf of Michael Christopher Schindhelm in court for State of Wisconsin. Case in court to address a request for involuntary medication order. Defendant is not participating in the proceeding. Discussion regarding defendant's lack of participation in the court proceeding. Court addressed defendant who can hear the proceeding, but is not participating. Hearing proceeded. Sworn as witness: Dr. Cohen. Testimony proceed.
Hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.

RESERVE BRANCH 25 for BRANCH 12:

Defendant Stephanie A King not in court, in custody.  Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons Ms in court for Stephanie A King.  Attorney Michael Christopher Schindhelm in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court has been requested to hear the issue of involuntary administration of medication.
Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance for purposes of this hearing.
Case is unable to proceed today due to technical difficulties commencing video conferencing.

Defense counsel and the State are prepared to waive time limits.
Discussion as to adjournment of the hearing, availability of the doctor, etc.
Court finds that the time limits have been extended to 20 days from the filing of the request.

Case is adjourned for hearing in Reserve Branch 25.
Deputy clerk to email doctor regarding their availability as to the next court date.

Clerk:  jms
Notice of Motion for Court Order of Medication and/or Treatment received and filed.  bm
Letter to the Court requesting administration of involuntary medication from Dr. Candace Cohen received and filed.  bm
Cover Sheet for Confidential Records received and filed.  bm
Case calendared for Status Conference October 5, 2022.  Court advised Defendant has been transferred to Mendota.  Matter removed from the October 5, 2022 calendar.  bm
Letter to the Court Advising  Defendant has been transferred to Mendota Mental Health received and filed.  bm

Defendant Stephanie A King not in court, in custody.  Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons Ms in court for Stephanie A King.  Attorney Michael Christopher Schindhelm in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Case calendared for Hearing this date.  Court adjourns matter due to long sentencing on another matter.  Attorney Anne Bensky of DHS who appeared via Zoom advised of new date.
Hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Letter from Anne Bensky of DHS regarding Stephanie King received and filed.  bm

Defendant Stephanie A King not in court, in custody.  Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons Ms in court for Stephanie A King.  Attorney Michael Christopher Schindhelm in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Status Conference held.  Defendant has not been transferred to DHS.  Parties advised DHS will be contacted and must appear on the next date.
Hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Hearing exhibits from 08/18/2022 inventoried on this date.
Location: BOX 789
Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) signed and filed.  bm
FORTHWITH Order to transport signed and filed.  bm

Defendant Stephanie A King in court with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Stephanie A King in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Case in court for Competency Hearing.  Parties in receipt of examiner's report.  Parties stipulate to Dr. Goebel's qualifications.  Defense does not stip to Dr. Goebel's qualifications as to forced medications.   Court qualified Dr. Goebel to testify as an expert in the field of psychology.   Sworn for the State:  Dr. Jenna Goebel. Direct examination.  Exhibit #1 marked, offered and received.  Cross examination.  Testimony closed.  Arguments heard. After review of all evidence, report and testimony of Dr. Goebel, Court finds the defendant lacks substantial capacity to understand court proceedings or to assist in her own defense.  Court orders proceedings suspended.   Court ordered defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care in order to restore competency within the statutory time frame.  Order of Commitment signed and filed.  Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for transportation to the designated facility. FORTHWITH. 
Court orders case adjourned for Status to determine if Defendant has been transported and for Review.  Defense to submit order as to forthwith transport.  Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Review hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Case rescheduled for Hearing due to Dr. Goebel not being available on July 6, 2022.  Case scheduled for Hearing August 18, 2022, at 8:30 am.; Dr. Goebel's availability confirmed.  Both parties agree to new Hearing date, via email; IN PERSON.

Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons in court, defendant Stephanie A King not in court, in custody.  Defendant's Appearance Waived.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for Competency Hearing.  Defendant refuses to appear in Court, in person or by Zoom.  Defense requested adjournment to allow more time to talk with Defendant.  Hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons in court, defendant Stephanie A King not in court, in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate for Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for Competency Hearing.  Defendant refuses to appear in Court, in person or by Zoom.  Defense requested adjournment to allow time to talk with Defendant.  Dr. Goebel agreed to new adjourned Hearing date, via phone.  Hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Stephanie A King in court with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Stephanie A King in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Zoom.  Deputy Court Clerk: nk
Case in Court for Doctor's Report Return.  Defense requesting Competency Hearing.  Defendant REMANDED until Competency Hearing.
Letter from defendant.  (Stephanie A. King - #2022003927, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Attorney Ashley Fard for Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons in court, defendant Stephanie A King not in court, in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: nk
Case calendar for return on doctor report this date.  Attorney Fitzsimmons remains on medical leave.  Attorney Fard requests adjournment.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Competency Report received and filed.  bm
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel received and filed.  bm
Forensic evaluation ordered.  INITIAL APPEARANCE NOT HELD.  Trial court to address INITIAL APPEARANCE on next court date.

Defendant Stephanie A King in court with attorney David Conley.  Defendant Stephanie A King in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Stephanie A King appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Commissioner tolls the time limits for the preliminary hearing.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 08:30 am
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
